Settlement Risk: To construct the first proxy, Supplier Z-Score, we first calculate the Z-score (Altman, 1968) for all firms in Compustat and then aggregate firm-year Z-scores by two-digit NAICS code to construct industry characteristics, and define Industry Z-Score as the median industry Z-score. The weighting procedure for all supplier-industry variables is identical as for Supplier Industry HHI. Supplier settlement risk is high if the Supplier Z-Score is below the sample mean and low if above that threshold.13 Alternative Settlement Risk: Supplier Tangibility is based on the same process as Supplier ZScore.
Tangibility is computed following Almeida and Campello (2007), and it is sales-weighted by supplier industry for each downstream customer industry.
